intro: Peucedanum tongkangense, commonly known as the Tongkang angelica, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, containing compounds with potential anti-inflammatory effects. The leaves and seeds are also used in traditional herbal remedies.
